intro: Senecio hanburyanus, commonly known as the Hanbury's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by small, hairy fruits. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
